data.title: Clean water
data.body: Needed a new pitcher after our previous one broke when dropped. Shopped around for affordability and quality, came across this one and we love it!! Water pours out smoothly, filter is easy to install, water tastes great, and my child loved being able to pick from the variety of colors to purchase one in a color she liked. We have zero issues with the filter or lid. Size is perfect for a child to use for independence and adult to pour a full glass of water as well. It didn’t take long at all either to refil the pitcher. Would purchase again if we find ourselves needing a second one

data.title: Good product
data.body: I have had this for several days and it works fine. I got it not so much to bad tastes or smells in my local tap water but to hopefully filter out lead which has no odour or taste--just in case my older apartment has lead pipes which I assume it has. I drink 80- 100 oz of water daily, in form or decaf teas and water for health and workouts so, IF I'm drinking lead---I was getting a good amount over time. Nice pitcher and it doesn't take much space in my tight kitchen.

data.title: Great Water!
data.body:
This Brita with the Elite filter, gives the smoothest, cleanest, most delicious water I have had in a long time. Our kitchen sink is broken underneath, so until we have the new sink put in, we use the sink in the bathroom. Which would be ok, but it just seems a tiny bit funky. It could be my imagination, but it bothered me so much, that I broke down and bought this Brita. The pitcher is strong, not flimsy, as it has been reported to be. It is attractive when left on the counter. It is easy to fill, you just open the top, and gently hold it open for a second, and it will stay open. The water filters fast! I love my water again! I keep the pitcher in the refrigerator for very cold, refreshing water.

The only thing I would change would be to get the larger pitcher. I bought the 6 cup, which is fine. But, when we get a refrigerator with more room, I will buy a larger Brita pitcher. I am just happy to have such clean water. Even our dog seems to be drinking more water! All in all, this is a great pitcher, and I am happy with my purchase.

data.title: Perfect size
data.body: Works great! The perfect size to allow plenty of room in the fridge, while giving great quality filtered water.

data.title: Easy to clean and removes hard minerals
data.body: I live somewhere in Texas where the water is HARD. We have strong chlorine and sulfur tastes in our tap water. I was sick of purchasing gallon jugs every week so I decided to get the pro filter. It removes the nasty taste of the tap water. It doesn't taste like the purified water that comes in stores, but that's probably better for my health anyway. The automatic filter change system also is a great, helpful reminder when to change the filter.

data.title: Very light weight
data.body: Great little pitcher. Filters about 32-40 oz at a time. I like the oval shape but don't like that it's more susceptible to being knocked over if bumped. That's just my personal clumsiness coming through and this is still worth a 5 star rating. I love that it's so lightweight. Love the red color option too.

data.title: Works good
data.body: I bought it to see if it would make a difference using the filtered water with my coffee pot,It really made a difference ,I had been having trouble with my coffee tasting bitter and even after descaling it and changing coffee,I read that it could be the water so I bought this water filter and it really worked, my coffee tasted so much better. It’s a good price and fits perfect in my fridge without taking up too much room.

data.title: A no-brainer
data.body: My old water pitcher had seen better days, I had modified it to accept Britta filters. I decided to stick with Britta when the replacement was needed. Drinking water is provided by an anti-microbe pitcher so the Britta with premium filter serves the intended purpose for cooking and pet water. The pitcher arrived undamaged and there were no defects. First use preparation was included. I like the size, water taste and filter indicator of this pitcher. As per other reviews the pitcher seems somewhat light duty but I only want to fill it with water and pour it out. I see no issues personally with the integrity of the product. If it does stand up to regular use I would certainly buy again.

data.title: This is a GREAT Plan "B"
data.body:
We installed a new faucet system for our kitchen sink... one that has one of those institutional, flexible sprayer heads on it. We used to use a PUR filter directly on the faucet before we installed this, but now there is no way to use a PUR. So until we decide to install a stand alone water filter, we fill up the Brita pitcher and use that!

We have a second Brita as well. It is a bigger one with a spout that we keep in the fridge. That is our drinking water. This pitcher is our "cooking/Keirig/cat dish/everything else" water.

And to tell the truth... this has ended up being much easier on us than the PUR filter installed on the faucet as before. To fill our Keirig (which is often), we just grab our Brita picture, walk over, and fill our coffee maker! Before, we had to get a pitcher or bowl, wait for the PUR to do it's thing, then carry it over to our coffee bar to use it, then we'd have to put the pitcher or bowl in the dish drainer to air dry.

Which of the two seems simpler to you?

data.title: Good but not as good as the original Britas
data.body:
This pitcher is a little small, it takes a full pitcher to fill my 40 ounce insulated cup (NOT that overly hyped up trendy brand!) I find this to be acceptable for one person, I drink 2 pitchers of filtered water every day. It’s convenient that 1 pitcher closely equals my 40 ounce tumbler. I used Brita when they originally cane out and don’t know what’s different but it does seem that the water has a slight taste whereas originally, Brita pitchers pretty much removed all taste from my tap water. It might just be that my tap water is that bad now.

It’s very easy and quick to put a new filter in and toss out the first couple of pitchers. It does a decent job of filtering out chlorine and other yucky tap water taste. I do think some brands of bottled water taste better but I love not having to buy bottled water anymore, the Brita allows me to drink tap water which I cannot stomach unfiltered and I save a lot of money as well as help the environment.

A good buy that I am happy with. I see no issues with the design,I very slightly underfill it and it filters quickly and I fill my tumbler and recill the pitcher and put it in the fridge for my refill later in the day. This size will not work for a family but is perfect for just me. The filters are convenient and easy to find and a breeze to replace. I don’t think the indicator light is necessary and I could do without that feature but if Brita wants an indicator to light up on my pitcher lid, okay then!

I recommend this, everyone needs to drink more water..

data.title: Works well
data.body: One week in and so far so good. I did notice the taste of my water and the clarity was improved with the Elite filter. I was amazed that the water was crystal clear. It took filling and emptying four times at the beginning for the waters taste to level off. Container is a thin plastic and I think the reason it doesn't close right to the edge is to prevent mold. I really like the indicator light feature, also this smaller pitcher is quite heavy when full. So glad I didn't get the larger one. The smaller pitcher also fits nicely in the door of my older refrigerator. Overall, I would recommend this Brita Metro pitcher. I would buy another one if they make the Stream version in the smaller size.

data.title: Small water pitcher but works
data.body: I was not sure how large this pitcher was going to be. I actually thought it was going to be a full-size picture like my mom has, but hers must be an extra large size. So, when I unboxed it I was a little disappointed because it seemed so tiny. But it actually works pretty well with my fridge, because I don’t have much space in it anyways. And I really bought it to filter my ferrets water, so I didn’t need it to hold a lot. It holds 2-24oz cups worth of water. One thing I don’t like about it is that the little flap that you lift up to fill it, falls down super easily while you are trying to fill it. This has resulted in me getting water all over on the little display and presumably where the battery is located. I worry that it might do something to the battery or ruin the electrical components, but so far that hasn’t happened.

data.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS!!
data.body: We have very hard water with lots of iron in it so I was buying distilled water for my electric tea kettle and percolator. The I felt bad about the plastic bottles, so we gave this a try. I haven't had to clean the tea pot or percolator of iron stains at all! I was very skeptical but this WORKS SO WELL and the tea and coffee taste great! So does the water! HIGHLY RECOMMEND and I am producing LESS PLASTIC WASTE!!

data.title: Better than expected.
data.body:
I am a huge water snob. I refuse to drink our city water due to its pungent, chemical smell and taste and UFOs (unidentified floating objects). But I'm tired of the plastic waste you get with bottled water and the extra money I have to spend to have clean, drinkable water.

This surprised me. It didn't completely eliminate that chemical smell, but it wasn't as strong. The taste still wasn't as "clean" as bottled water, but it was a significant improvement. I'm planning on using the pitcher for coffee, tea, and cooking.

data.title: Nice sized pitcher for one person
data.body: The blue is a great deep blue. The pitcher is well sized for a single individual, i would suggest larger for a family. Easy to put together, the instructions on the filter LEDs were a bit confusing, so i removed a star on east of use. It was unclear if the supplied filter was an advanced filter or not. A quick google search helped me find that it came with a simple filter. Filter is supposed to work for about 3 months. I'll buy the smart filters for refill. Overall i like it.

data.title: Makes the tap water taste better
data.body: This product does wonders for the taste of our tap water. Before using the tap water always had a slight weird taste to it. After using this, the tap water tastes better than bottled water. Wish I would have bought a bigger size though as this one is only 6 cups and we go through a lot of water. Will be purchasing more.

data.title: Does what it's designed to do.
data.body: I like the color and size. This particular size is not large, so consider capacity before ordering or you'll spend a lot of time refilling. Still on original filter so unable to comment on longevity. As far as taste, it is fine. Been on the same municipal water for 43 years. It's good tasting at the tap but I run through at least two charcoal filters, three if you count my K-cup machine. Unless I convert to reverse osmosis (not practical, my opinion) I'm enjoying healthy, good tasting and well-filtered water, and even better tasting coffee.

data.title: So happy with it, but I wish I had gotten the larger size
data.body: I'd wanted to get a filter system of some kind for a long time now so I could stop having to buy pack after pack of water bottles. I love this pitcher so much, honestly one of the best decisions I've made in a long time. Since it's just me using it I got the smaller size though which only fits about 3 glasses of water at a time. I don't mind refilling it every time I fill a glass but I do think the bigger one would be more convenient overall. Definitely recommend though if you're trying to get away from having to buy a pack of water every week and reduce plastic use.

data.title: Love it
data.body:
Wow!! After years of using single use plastic bottles for water, I bought my Britta and it really makes the water taste so much better.
You will be surprised at how easy it is to use and knowing that the water you are drinking is filtered and tastes great

data.title: How Did I Get By Without This?
data.body:
I already had a Brita bottle, and I am 100% sold on the flavor of water that goes through these filters. However, the bottle requires a lot of "sucking" and became a bit uncomfortable with use over time. Now I usually filter my water through this pitcher and then pour the water into another bottle (a 20-26 oz bottle carries me through several hours; for a day long trip, I take my 64 oz bottle). Its design makes it very easy to fit into my refrigerator (I keep another 64 oz bottle of Brita filtered water in the fridge as well so I always have cold filtered water).

The only concern, which is extremely mild, is that it takes a bit of time at first to fill as the water passes through the filter, but it's quicker as time goes along.

This is one of the best purchases I have made!

data.title: Flavor
data.body: I purchased the Brita because my tap water has a chemical taste. The Brita eliminated most of the bad taste, so I'm glad I purchased it. Also, for the customer who complained about the time it takes to refill the pitcher, try this: when the water level gets down to about 3 inches, simply fill the top reservoir and put the pitcher back in the refrigerator. You don't have to wait 2-3 minutes at the faucet.

data.title: Spout is bigger
data.body: I like the brand Brita. I like that it is light only 6 cups and able to use it everyday to rid of plastic bottles. The only thing I don't like about it is it has a big spout. The spout is as big as my 10 cup Brita filter pitcher. You have to be careful not to spill in pouring water to your cup.

data.title: Decent filter, but it has a flaw.
data.body: The filter is well made and I love the picture very much. However, when you fill it up with water you have to let all of the water sift to the bottom as much as possible before trying to pour because unfiltered water can still leak through the spout, because the seam line doesn't fit watertight. So it forces you to wait till the water's filtered as much as possible.

data.title: That it works well.
data.body: I have used Britta water jugs for many years. The 1 I have is larger and I wanted the same size. This one is smaller in size. In the description it doesn't state the capacity amount. I keep 1 at room temperature and the other one is in the fridge. The one that I bought did not stand up to the 2 month standard for the filter. I've already had to change the filter in it. I write the date on my calendar as to when I should change the filter and it fell short of the time frame. I get the filter that supposed to last 2 months.

data.title: Pure drinking water at a savings
data.body: This is the second Brita pitcher I have owned. The tap water here in AZ tastes terrible. I rely on my Brita pitcher to make my tap water drinkable. It’s convenient, and it represents a great savings over buying bottled water.

data.title: College Dorm Essential
data.body: My son was only drinking/buying bottled water in his dorm until I gave him this Brita pitcher. He can now drink the dorm water and says it tastes so much better. This pitcher and filter is amazing.

data.title: My well water taste great using this filter.
data.body: My well water is very "hard". Full of lord knows what. Orange stains in shower and toilet. I figured I'd use a filter for drinking. This filter seems to work very well. Have yet to replace the filter cartridge and that will be the determining factor. How often will I be replacing cartridges. One other little annoying thing. The design of bottom of the container is rounded in for some reason. This makes it a bit unstable on my refrigerator rack. Why did they do that??

data.title: Works fast and delivers great clean water.
data.body:
Experience refreshing hydration like never before with the Brita Water Pitcher. This sleek and efficient pitcher transforms tap water into a crisp and clean taste sensation in no time. Boasting a rapid filtration system, it swiftly removes impurities and odors, ensuring every sip is pure and invigorating. Perfect for busy households, its quick functionality ensures you'll always have delicious, filtered water readily available for your hydration needs.

Not only does the Brita Water Pitcher work swiftly, but it also delivers an unmatched taste experience. Say goodbye to the dullness of tap water and hello to the vibrant flavor of crisp, filtered water. Whether you're at home or on-the-go, this pitcher is your go-to solution for enjoying great-tasting water that's free from those pesky contaminants and full of pure, refreshing goodness.

data.title: $$$ Saver to the max !!
data.body: The best purchase I made. No more plastic bottles for me.. 6 cups of pure clean water is great but purchasing the 3 pack blue filters which i did on Ebay for such a low price is even greater.. 98% cleaner water.. Water with white filter taste clean & crisp , blue will be even greater...Why did I wait so long..Well glad I finally purchased the Brita. like I write the best 2024 purchase for the new year..Thank you Brita and Amazon.....

data.title: Mostly Pretty Good Water Filter
data.body: Our old water filter was 8-cups (I think) and it was a round container that was taking up too much space on the kitchen counter. This one holds 6-cups and while I enjoy how sleek it is, I wish that it's shape was a bit different. Most kitchen sinks 'slope' down towards the drain; as in: the bottom of the sink is not completely flat. Because of the design of this water pitcher, it is slimmer at the bottom than at the top. This means that it cannot be placed in the sink to be filled - I have to hold it mid-air until the water hits the 'fill' mark. It isn't ungodly heavy, but sometimes it'd be nice to set it in the sink and let the water pour into it without having to hold it. But I can't, because it tips over.

data.title: Love it!
data.body: Water does not have an appealing smell to it, I will not drink it. After purchasing this product, the smell is gone and I drink the water non-stop!

data.title: Great
data.body: This seems to work fine, it filters out all of the impurities that we cannot see or taste or smell. Even has a little green light on the top of it but I don’t know what that light means. I asked my wife and she just said it means it is working. The water tastes great, so lifelike!

data.title: Excellent tasting water
data.body:
Helping the environment by not having many plastic bottles to discard
About $8-10 for a replacement filter which takes care of 40 gallons of water
Great savings

data.title: Save Money
data.body: My family went through a crazy amount of water bottles as everyone is in sports but this helps save so much money. The filter lasts a long time and works well. Our water is well water so it has a funny taste. We can't taste it after the water has been filtered. I have had it for over a year and the filter is still going strong.

data.title: Great little 6 cup...water looks and tastes clean
data.body: The first one I got had a cracked spout. As soon as I informed them within 2 days had another. Great customer service.

data.title: Awesome
data.body: I’m happy with this purchase because it’s helping me to drink more water without buying it the store. I do need some replacement filters shortly.

data.title: Great size for a full fridge!
data.body: This is a small Brita, which is what we needed for a fridge that stores everything. And it’s great for a small dorm sized fridge.

data.title: Good
data.body: Not sure how much it filters, but works great. Amazon is cheaper than any other store for this water filter, even the cheap stores :).

data.title: Perfect size
data.body: Bought this for my college student son to put in the refrigerator in the dorm room and it’s a perfect fit!! he and his roommates use it on repeat day in and day out. Highly recommend.

data.title: It's a Brita pitcher
data.body: With current news not sure if Brita filters even work... but if it does work then it's decent.

data.title: Holds up to heavy use.
data.body: We've had this for a couple months now and with very heavy use (filling it up full 3-8 times a day) it has held up perfect. We have used one filter and about to put a new one in and are very happy with this method.

data.title: Love it
data.body: I love this Brita Metro Water Filter Pitcher. I like it the best. It is so nice to have it

data.title: Good looks and function
data.body: Been using these for a week now, and they seem to be really good. I haven't had to clean yet, but I imagine it will be easier to clean than the previous model. Very happy with them so far.

data.title: Glad we bought it!
data.body: The water tastes different and is good. Always wanted to try this and glad I finally bought a pitcher.

data.title: Everything else is great, but there’s a gap
data.body: I have bought the Brita filters a few times and they all worked well. Not sure why for this one when I close the lid and other parts closed seamlessly but there’s a gap like shown in the picture. Is it the design or it’s a defect??

data.title: the lid does not fit perfectly
data.body: The lid does not fit perfectly and unfiltered water also comes out through this opening.

data.title: It works
data.body: Our water has a strong bleach smell and taste. I bought this because of that and now i don't taste our smell black when i drink. It works as described

data.title: It's ok, but not as good as the full size Brita
data.body: We purchased this smaller Brita to use when we go camping. We have had the full-size Brita for years and love it. This smaller version is still good but definitely a little more flimsy than the full-size version. The inner sleeve that holds the filter in place fits into the pitcher well but because the pitcher is made of a thinner plastic, the sleeve slides out easily when you turn the unit upside down. When the lid is on the pitcher there is no problem. Overall, we are satisfied with this Brita.

data.title: Works great!
data.body: Can't drink my tap water. I already had one, bought this for my son cause he liked mine so much. We use it for coffee and it filters the tap water here so it's actually better tasting enough to drink!! Love it!!!

data.title: Works great!
data.body: Love, love, love this. Great size and works wonderful. I love the blinking light on top that shows you when you need to replace filter. What an awesome idea. I use this every single day, multiple times a day. Get it… You’ll love it!

data.title: small size and perfect fit
data.body: I had a water filter prior that was too big and clunky. I am glad that they created one that fits my fridge without taking up too much space.

data.title: Buy it!
data.body: I can definitely taste the difference and using this filter is better than drinking water bottles. Thank you Brita!!!

data.title: Fast and easy water filtration
data.body: Easy to setup and use. You may want to get the larger one if you use it consistently.

data.title: helping mother earth in my small way. wahooo
data.body: I simply love them, brought one for the fridge and one for the counter top, and my plants.

data.title: Love it
data.body: Stopped me from buying bottled water. Saved a lot of money. I love the taste of my water.

data.title: Clean water
data.body: I'm glad I bought this item. I really enjoy using it. If it's in my fridge just perfectly

data.title: The best thing I bought
data.body: I definitely taste a difference in my water. Me and my kids drink from the pitcher everyday

data.title: Good gift
data.body: I bought for my daughter, she love the fact she don't have to buy bottle water anymore.

data.title: Good water filter pitcher
data.body: I bought this for my daughter and she likes it. Unfortunately someone visited her and broke it.

data.title: Nice
data.body: It filter the water good. It was a bit plasticky lol than I thought it would feel. But it is very pretty and it did it’s job which is to filter the water. I would recommend.

data.title: I did the drinking water strip tests
data.body: The left is the Brita, and the right strip is just tap water. What a difference!

data.title: Compact filtering pitcher
data.body: This filtering pitcher is easy to use. Its size makes it easy to handle, to pour, and to refill. The red color is very attractive.

data.title: Cracked
data.body: Dislike was it came cracked in side. The white item.

data.title: Great filtration ❗️
data.body: I l bought 2, 1 for plants + dog, + 1 for me. 5 stars

data.title: Nicely made
data.body: Great pitcher. Love how the water runs through so quickly and purifies it. Great taste too!

data.title: Prefect size
data.body: I like that the filter has a light that flashes to show the filter is still working. The size of the container is easy to handle a it pours nice.

data.title: Brita water pitcher
data.body: I love this pitcher use it daily easy to assemble and water tastes fresh daily

data.title: Excellent taste
data.body: Cheap water filter. Tap water has a strange chemical smell, and this filter can completely remove it.

data.title: It really filters the water
data.body: I love this one as it filters the water great. The jug is very strong

data.title: Brita pitcher and filter.
data.body: The water comes fresh and clear. It taste so good and refreshing. Thank you, Brita.

data.title: i like it
data.body: it's a good size and easy to fill. i wish it had the blinker to tell u when the filter needs to be changed and i wish it had a little topper near the lid to slow the water down when u pour (i have made many a mess from it pouring too fast)

data.title: Good Shape & Easy to fill
data.body: Love the way it’s shaped, fits good in door of my fridge. It’s easy to fill with water from tap to be filtered..

data.title: This smaller Brita is easy to handle
data.body: This smaller Brita sits on the coffee bar for easy filling the coffee maker. We notice our coffee tastes better. Long lasting filters

data.title: Great item
data.body: It's a little smaller than I thought but that is on me not reading the description closely. It filters the water well and takes my city water taste out. It was easy to set up, use and the filtering is much faster than the models years ago. Great product. I stick with this brand since it's easy to find filters.

data.title: Great taste!
data.body: This unit is easy to use and the water tastes good! We change the filter monthly, which is seasonably priced.

data.title: Smaller then expected
data.body: Make sure to pay attention to the size. Smaller then anticipated based on a previous purchase of a Brita pitcher years ago. Works sadvertised.

data.title: Great pitcher, a little small, handle is flimsy.
data.body: Classic Brita pitcher, so you know the water and filter quality will be high. This is a tiny pot, and the handle is pretty flimsy. On the plus side, there is an indicator showing when the filter needs replaced.

data.title: Less impact on environment
data.body:
I previously purchased bottle water for a family of four. This meant that we were purchasing bottle after bottle of water to drink for the taste, the convenience, and because tap water has so many additives. This brita filter system is a great alternative.

Pros: Easy to assemble, easy to use, and less impact or waste on the environment. Over time save money also. Cost is comparable to other fillers. Less waste (filter when it has to be change). Green light indicates on the top signals when the filter needs to be changed.

Cons: This model is small and has to be refilled constantly. Higher upfront cost compared to bottle water.

data.title: Great
data.body: I love this picture as it’s smaller than the other one. I have much easier and lighter to handle. Wish I could give it more than five stars does not leak when you pour excellent little product.

data.title: Jug
data.body: The jug is okay , however , on another shopping site you get an extra filter with your purchase at no extra charges

data.title: Comes with only one filter
data.body: You are constantly refilling and will need more filters.

data.title: Worth it.
data.body: The only reason I put a 4 as my rating is because the color is not teal like the picture. The product itself is great!! I'm very pleased to have purchased it!!

data.title: Loving it
data.body: My only regret is not ordering a bigger one. I'm loving the clean water.

data.title: Easy to use
data.body: It does as it claims removes chemical taste in water. It is small so it doesn't take up much room in the fridge.

data.title: Best Water Ever
data.body: I was surprised at how much better my water suddenly became. I am on a well and concerned about what was in the water. Brita is always clear, fresh and wonderfully tasting. I wish I had bought it sooner, it is far better than the bottled and jug store bought options. If you have any doubt about your water this is the way to go.

data.title: works as intended
data.body: i keep this one in my bathroom for when i need a drink of water in the night and don’t want to go to the kitchen. can be a bit finicky to disassemble and i prefer my pur filters water but its still better than just tap

data.title: Filters quickly
data.body: I needed skinny to fit in my always crowded refrigerator. Water tastes great. I like how quickly the water filters through. I have not ordered replacement filters yet. I hope that will not be a problem.

data.title: Design could be better.
data.body: While the device works as advertised, the design isn't the best. The pitcher tapers from top to bottom, which means when filled with water, it is a bit top-heavy. Also, it needs some sort of non-skid base. It is prone to tippong and spilling.

data.title: Nice for storafe
data.body: Easy to use and slim fit. Not huge

data.title: Great improvement to local water
data.body: This filter system has greatly improved the taste of our local water agency's well water. I was using bottled water and am now using only filtered tap water. Good for the environment and my pocketbook.

data.title: Perfect
data.body: Great product, easy to use and the water tastes so much better now.

data.title: Save water bottles
data.body: Use the filter pitcher is always more environmental friendly compared to water bottles.

data.title: Great product
data.body: Didn't realize at time of arrival but inside part was cracked. So I put a piece of tape over the crack. Use it everyday and it's nice to have filtered water.

data.title: It's light
data.body: I like the product it's very easy to use not complicated at all . It's light not heavy even when you add water into it does not make it heavy .

data.title: Brita water quality
data.body: The quality of the water taste was typical of Brita. I didn't pay attention to the size & got the small 6 cup instead of the 10 cup that it replaced. The filter indicator was awkward, letting me know when I'm pouring rather than filling. Sadly, I didn't have it long enough to rate on easy to clean... knocked it off the countertop when I grabbed for a glass that slipped out of a cabinet. Definitely breaks easily. ha

data.title: Filtered water
data.body: Kind of small. Have to refill frequently

data.title: Compact
data.body: This is a bit small but works fairly well the only and I mean only issue with it is that the water reservoir lid isn't sealed tight enough to pour water with water still filtering. It will just come out of the unfiltered reservoir when there is some left in there when you pour.

data.title: Love it
data.body: I bought one of these for my daughter and son-in-law for Christmas just one of my grandbabies to have healthier water. I loved it so much I bought one for myself no more plastic bottles.

data.title: Water taste amazing!!!
data.body: I was always one of those that said all water tastes the same, but I can honestly say I can tell a huge difference. The water is so smooth and crisp.
